result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexis M. Isola was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections.  If probation is ordered an ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the Medford Police Department within 30 days and must be preapproved by probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexis M. Isola

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Alexis M. Isola in court with attorney Shawn M Paul.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Agreement placed on the record by Ms. Tlusty.  DE entered plea of no contest to amended charge of Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing, Wis. Stat. 346.04(2t).  Plea colloquy.  Factual basis exists.  Court found plea given freely, voluntarily; and intelligently; accepted plea; found DE guilty and ordered entry of JOC.  Court withheld sentence and placed DE on probation for 1 year with the following conditions:  court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; counseling as deemed appropriate by agent; letter of apology to M.P.D. due within 30 days and approved by agent. ba
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 25, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 3, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Alexis M. Isola in court with attorney Shawn M Paul.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Waive reading of complaint, charges and penalties.  Waive time limits for a preliminary hearing.    Bond continued. Pretrial conference scheduled for March 14, 2015 at 9:15 am.  - rt

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without parent's consent.
Initial Appearance on February 23, 2016 at 1:00 p.m.

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Alexis M. Isola appeared in person, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requests a $1,000.00 signature bond; booking; no operation of a motor vehicle without parents' consent.  Court orders bond as requested by Attorney Tlusty.  Next court date is February 23, 2016 at 1:00 pm.  - rt
